column2: OKLAHOMA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Oklahoma
column6: OK

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Distractions that take your attention away from driving can be caused by ______ while driving.
column4: eating or drinking
column6: using your cell phone
column8: changing the radio

column2: 2. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there's an intersection ahead.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Railroad crossing ahead
column6: There is a traffic signal ahead
column8: You must stop ahead

column2: 4. When the road is slippery you should:
column4: decrease the following distance.
column6: slow and pro-ceed with caution.
column8: check your brakes.

column2: 5. Motorcyclists are entitled to use the full width of a traffic lane; therefore, a driver should pass a motorcycle the same way as passing another vehicle.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 6. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: wear approved helmets.
column6: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 7. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: you have put your turn signal on.
column6: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column10: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 8. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column8: come to a complete stop.

column2: 9. When passing another vehicle, before turning back into the right-hand lane drivers should wait until they can see the vehicle they are passing in the rearview mirror.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 10. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column8: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Do not enter
column6: No left turn
column8: No U-turn
column10: Do not pass on the left.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column6: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column8: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.

column2: 13. When a school bus is stopped with its red lights flashing:
column4: you never need to stop.
column6: drivers only need to stop if children are present.
column8: drivers may not pass while the red lights are flashing.
column10: drivers don't need to stop unless they are in a school zone.

column2: 14. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column6: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column8: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column10: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: The roadway you are traveling on ends ahead
column6: A road joins from the left
column8: You must bear either right or left

column2: 16. You have stopped for a train at a railroad crossing. After the train passes, you must:
column4: look to see if another train is coming, then cross the tracks if it is safe to do so.
column6: watch for vehicles that must stop at railroad crossings (school buses, vehicles carrying hazardous materials, etc.).
column8: All of the above.

column2: 17. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column4: stop where you are.
column6: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.
column8: stop in the right lane.

column2: 18. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column4: Arrows
column6: Edge line
column8: Crosswalk Lines

column2: 19. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column6: Leave the road immediately.
column8: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 20. Before passing a vehicle or changing lanes, remember to:
column4: only pass or change lanes if the change can be completed  without speeding.
column6: signal your return to the left lane.
column8: sound your horn as you pass.

column2: 21. Taking drugs and alcohol together:
column4: increase the risk of causing a crash.
column6: is no more dangerous than alcohol by itself.
column8: has no effect on your general driving ability.
column10: helps you get rid of the effects of alcohol in your body.

column2: 22. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column6: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column8: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column10: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 23. You can pass on the right:
column4: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column8: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column10: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.

column2: 24. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: can not turn left.
column6: must turn into its right lane.
column8: must go to the next intersection.
column10: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 25. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.
